title: Overview
content: Hunter is fully self-contained — traps and bait are obtained in-game or from general stores, not the Grand Exchange. Ironman Hunter training is essentially identical to P2P, making it one of the most ironman-friendly skills.
The Varrock Museum Natural History Quiz (1,000 free Hunter XP) is still the recommended first step. Box traps are purchased from the Hunter Stores or from Ava in Draynor.

title: Levels 1–63: Museum Quiz and Early Trapping
content: Complete the Varrock Museum Natural History Quiz first for 1,000 free XP (reaches level 9 from level 1). Then follow the same progression as P2P: Polar Kebbits, Swamp Lizards, and lower-tier Chinchompas through the level 40s and 50s.
Trap equipment (Box traps, Bird snares, Butterfly nets) is purchased from Hunter Stores near most hunting areas. Keep a stack in your bank.
Carnivorous Chinchompas from level 63 are the core training method. Unlike P2P players who may sell the chinchompas, ironmen benefit from keeping them as Ranged ammunition for chinning.

title: Levels 63–99: Chinchompas and Herbiboar
content: Red Carnivorous Chinchompas from level 63 are excellent XP and produce valuable Ranged ammo. As an ironman, chinchompas are one of your best sources of Ranged ammunition for AoE Ranged training — prioritise stockpiling them.

Herbiboar on Anachronia (level 80 Hunter, level 31 Herblore) provides both Hunter and Herblore XP per catch and gives a large variety of grimy herbs. For ironmen this is especially valuable as herbs are harder to obtain without the GE.
Follow the same high-level progression as P2P: Grenwalls at level 77 in Feldip Hills and Dinosaur hunting on Anachronia at level 80+ for strong XP rates and useful drops.
